arm_group.description: Moderate intensity exercise 3 times a week.
Exercise on their own. Follow current guidelines.

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a substudy of "Generation 100". In that study, 4000 healthy persons between 70 and
      75 will be randomised do moderate intensity, high intensity or control group, with 3 years
      of exercise. The investigators will follow these persons and register all who develop atrial
      fibrillation during these 3 years, and at follow-up after ended intervention to see if there
      is differences in the number of persons who develop atrial fibrillation in the 3 groups.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of 3 Years of Exercise on Development of Atrial Fibrillation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Participating in the "Generation 100" study

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

intervention.description: Advised to follow current guidelines for physical activity, but exercise on their own.

facility.name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of 3 Years of Exercise on Development of Atrial Fibrillation - A "Generation 100" Substudy

authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics
Norway: Norwegian Social Science Data Services

primary_outcome.description: People who already have the diagnosis before randomisation will not be counted.
primary_outcome.measure: Number of persons who develop atrial fibrillation during the 3 year intervention period

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of persons who develop atrial fibrillation during the 6 years after randomisation

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
